meanings.sent1: The clink of the coins in the jar was loud.
meanings.sent2: I heard a clink as the metal spoon fell on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The clink of the keys reminded me of a tiny bell.
meanings.sent4: The clink of the hammer against the metal echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent5: The clink of the wind chimes soothed me as I sat on the porch.

meanings.sent1: He spent a night in the clink for his misdeeds.
meanings.sent2: The thief was caught and thrown into the clink.
meanings.sent3: The clink was not a place anyone wanted to visit.
meanings.sent4: The clink was a cold and unwelcoming place.
meanings.sent5: The clink's walls seemed to whisper stories of past inmates.

meanings.definition: To make a sharp, metallic sound
meanings.sent1: I accidentally clinked the glasses together while washing them.
meanings.sent2: The metal chains clinked as the prisoner walked.
meanings.sent3: The forks clinked against the plates as we set the table.
meanings.sent4: The coins clinked in the piggy bank as I dropped them in.
meanings.sent5: The tools clinked in the toolbox as I moved it across the room.

meanings.definition: To cause to make a sharp, metallic sound
meanings.sent1: She clinked the glasses to signal the start of the celebration.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith clinked the metal pieces together to shape them.
meanings.sent3: He clinked the keys on purpose to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The musician clinked the cymbals together for a dramatic effect.
meanings.sent5: The chef clinked the pots and pans while preparing the meal.
